result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alvonte D Edwards

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM Defendant Alvonte D Edwards appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Alvonte D Edwards.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior conviction in 05CF2908. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective M. McDaniel. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated September 29, 2022; received and filed.
Received and Signed. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Alvonte D Edwards appeared by video.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Indigency hearing. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Krejci, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing to prelim court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-16-2022

Defendant Alvonte D Edwards appeared by video, without counsel, not in custody.  Attorney Alexander C. Dyer appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for indigency hearing.  Defendant requested a little more time to hire attorney.  Court ordered case adjourned for indigency hearing in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM. 
Indigency hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Indigency hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alvonte D Edwards in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Alvonte D Edwards in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Alvonte D Edwards in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alvonte D Edwards appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
